title: AWS launched
description: AWS launched its first service, Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service), in the United States

title: iPhone Anncounced
description: The first-generation iPhone was announced by thenâ€“Apple CEO Steve Jobs at Macworld, and launched later that year.

title: Facebook launched
description: Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook under the name of 'TheFacebook', he intended to create a website that could connect people around the university. Within twenty-four hours, it had somewhere between twelve hundred and fifteen hundred registrants.

title: World Wide Web Invented
description: Tim Berners-Lee proposed the concept of the World Wide Web, which revolutionized the way information is shared and accessed online.

title: Windows 95 Released
description: Microsoft released Windows 95, a major milestone in personal computing that popularized the graphical user interface and plug-and-play hardware support.

title: Google Founded
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin founded Google in September, introducing a new search engine that would eventually dominate the Internet.

title: Wi-Fi Alliance Formed
description: The Wi-Fi Alliance was founded, standardizing wireless networking technology that would become essential to modern connectivity.

title: YouTube Acquired by Google
description: Google acquired YouTube for $1.65 billion, laying the groundwork for the era of online video streaming.

title: Bitcoin Introduced
description: The concept of Bitcoin, a decentralized cryptocurrency, was introduced by an anonymous person or group known as Satoshi Nakamoto.

title: Instagram Launched
description: Instagram, a photo-sharing social media platform, was launched by Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger, rapidly gaining millions of users.

title: Amazon Echo released
description: Amazon introduced the Echo smart speaker, which popularized voice-activated digital assistants in homes.
